intro: Turritis humilis, commonly known as the little turk's cap, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmate, with five to seven lobes, and the plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils. Turritis humilis is often found in desert and scrub habitats, and it is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
